speaker: Host
text_entry: SCENE IV. A room in FORD'S house.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Enter PAGE, FORD, MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Tis one of the best discretions of a 'oman as ever

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I did look upon.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And did he send you both these letters at an instant?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Within a quarter of an hour.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pardon me, wife. Henceforth do what thou wilt;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I rather will suspect the sun with cold

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Than thee with wantonness: now doth thy honour stand

speaker: FORD
text_entry: In him that was of late an heretic,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: As firm as faith.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'Tis well, 'tis well; no more:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Be not as extreme in submission

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: As in offence.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: But let our plot go forward: let our wives

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yet once again, to make us public sport,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Appoint a meeting with this old fat fellow,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Where we may take him and disgrace him for it.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: There is no better way than that they spoke of.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How? to send him word they'll meet him in the park

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: at midnight? Fie, fie! he'll never come.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: You say he has been thrown in the rivers and has

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: been grievously peaten as an old 'oman: methinks

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: there should be terrors in him that he should not

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: come; methinks his flesh is punished, he shall have

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: no desires.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: So think I too.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Devise but how you'll use him when he comes,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: And let us two devise to bring him thither.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: There is an old tale goes that Herne the hunter,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Sometime a keeper here in Windsor forest,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Doth all the winter-time, at still midnight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Walk round about an oak, with great ragg'd horns;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And there he blasts the tree and takes the cattle

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And makes milch-kine yield blood and shakes a chain

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: In a most hideous and dreadful manner:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You have heard of such a spirit, and well you know

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The superstitious idle-headed eld

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Received and did deliver to our age

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: This tale of Herne the hunter for a truth.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why, yet there want not many that do fear

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: In deep of night to walk by this Herne's oak:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: But what of this?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Marry, this is our device;

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: That Falstaff at that oak shall meet with us.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Well, let it not be doubted but he'll come:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And in this shape when you have brought him thither,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: What shall be done with him? what is your plot?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: That likewise have we thought upon, and thus:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Nan Page my daughter and my little son

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And three or four more of their growth we'll dress

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Like urchins, ouphes and fairies, green and white,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: With rounds of waxen tapers on their heads,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And rattles in their hands: upon a sudden,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: As Falstaff, she and I, are newly met,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Let them from forth a sawpit rush at once

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: With some diffused song: upon their sight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We two in great amazedness will fly:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Then let them all encircle him about

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And, fairy-like, to-pinch the unclean knight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And ask him why, that hour of fairy revel,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: In their so sacred paths he dares to tread

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: In shape profane.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: And till he tell the truth,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Let the supposed fairies pinch him sound

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: And burn him with their tapers.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The truth being known,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We'll all present ourselves, dis-horn the spirit,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And mock him home to Windsor.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: The children must

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Be practised well to this, or they'll ne'er do't.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I will teach the children their behaviors; and I

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: will be like a jack-an-apes also, to burn the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: knight with my taber.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: That will be excellent. I'll go and buy them vizards.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: My Nan shall be the queen of all the fairies,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Finely attired in a robe of white.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: That silk will I go buy.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Aside

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And in that time

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Shall Master Slender steal my Nan away

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And marry her at Eton. Go send to Falstaff straight.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Nay I'll to him again in name of Brook

speaker: FORD
text_entry: He'll tell me all his purpose: sure, he'll come.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Fear not you that. Go get us properties

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And tricking for our fairies.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Let us about it: it is admirable pleasures and fery

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: honest knaveries.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt PAGE, FORD, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Go, Mistress Ford,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Send quickly to Sir John, to know his mind.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit MISTRESS FORD

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I'll to the doctor: he hath my good will,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And none but he, to marry with Nan Page.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: That Slender, though well landed, is an idiot;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And he my husband best of all affects.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The doctor is well money'd, and his friends

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Potent at court: he, none but he, shall have her,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Though twenty thousand worthier come to crave her.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit
